One month after last registration date
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {73714=Students earn a Bachelor Degree in Business Information System from Cape Breton University (CBU) with a concentration in either Information Management or Networking in Canada. This program allows students to receive a letter of acceptance with his/her ID from  CBU once they fulfill CBU’s admission requirements. Students can also transfer to CBU for the Fall semester in September in Canada during their program as long as they fulfill the requirements of such transfer., 121677=Current areas of study include Networking, PC Hardware, Operating Systems, Oracle, C++, System Analysis and Design, Java, Windows Server 2000, Visual Basic, Database Development, Internet Fundamentals, IT Project Management, IT Documentation and Information Systems., 77368=Students earn both a Bachelor Degree in Business Information System from Cape Breton University (CBU) with a concentration in either Information Management or Networking in Canada as well as a Bachelor Degreeof Information Technology or Network Technology from CIC in Cairo accredited from both CIC and the Ministry of Higher Education in Egypt. This program allows students to receive a letter of acceptance with his/her ID from  CBU once they fulfill CBU’s admission requirements. Students can also transfer to CBU for the Fall semester in September in Canada during their program as long as they fulfill the requirements of such transfer. However, students have to come back to CIC within two academic years for an exam in the courses they studied at CBU to receive the Egyptian accredited certificate and this should be done in coordination with the International Affairs Department at CIC.}

Fees are paid in two installments one per semester in September and January of every academic year., 3497=1.  Fees are paid in two installments one per semester in September and January of every academic year., 78004=* Plus Insurance (Refundable), L.E 2000 (Paid only once). }
textBeforeTable: Students must pay all off the balance of all their fees during registration before the announced deadline (usually the first two weeks of classes). Any outstanding fees remaining will be charged a late fine as per the table below. Students who still have not paid off all their fees after the deadlines mentioned below will have their final exam results blocked and may be denied access to campus until all and any outstanding financial issues are settled. textAfterTable: Students who for any reason drop a course/semester or withdraw from CIC, will be subject to the refund policy as stated below: Refund Policy Fall/Spring Semester Drop Refund in Fees Academic Penalty First – Second week of Classes 100% None Third week 75% None Fourth week 50% None Fifth week 25% None Sixth week  No refund W Seventh week No refund F Summer Semester Drop Refund in Fees Academic Penalty First week of Classes 100% None Second week 75% None Third week 50% None Fourth week 25%
